H0.text: Cooler, because it absorbs less sunlight, is what the black can would most likely be compared to the white can after being left in the Sun for 3 hours.

H1.text: Cooler, because it absorbs more sunlight, is the condition that the black can would most likely be compared to the white can after both were left outside in the sun for 3â€¯hours.

H2.text: The black can would most likely be warmer, because it absorbs less sunlight, compared to the white can after being left in the Sun for 3 hours.

H3.text: Warmer, because it absorbs more sunlight, is what the black can would most likely be compared to the white can after both empty metal cans of the same size were left outside on a hot day in the sun for 3 hours.

A4.text: A black body absorbs all incident electromagnetic radiation, regardless of frequency or angle of incidence.

A5.text: A white body is one with a 'rough surface that reflects all incident rays completely and uniformly in all directions.'
